News Abstract: Here’s how business executives and donors are evaluating Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota, especially on taxes, labor unions, energy policy and more.
News Content: It’s been nearly 24 hours since Kamala Harris announced Gov. Tim Walz of Minnesota as her running mate, catapulting him into the national spotlight.

News Title: Wednesday Briefing: Hamas Will Skip Upcoming Talks
News Abstract: Plus, in Russian territory captured by Ukraine.
News Content: International mediators are heading to the Middle East for a high-stakes round of cease-fire negotiations scheduled for tomorrow. But Hamas will not take part in the talks because its leaders do not think Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s government has been negotiating in good faith, an official for the group said.

News Title: Prediction Markets Tell a Different Story From the Polls
News Abstract: Supporters say the platforms are better at predicting the election. But questions have arisen about recent big bets, as they show a big lead for Donald Trump.
News Content: Polls show the U.S. presidential contest as neck and neck. But a popular new way of tracking the race — and betting on it — is telling a different story.

News Title: For Vance, an Idyllic Appalachian Startup Became a Hard Lesson
News Abstract: During JD Vance’s brief career as a venture capitalist, few startups attracted his support more than AppHarvest, a now bankrupt plan to build greenhouses across Appalachia.
News Content: For JD Vance, it seemed like the perfect investment.

News Title: What Washing Machines Can Tell Us About America’s Economic Future
News Abstract: One set of writers on the left and another on the right lay out competing visions for what the next president should do.
News Content: Much of the 2024 election has been extraordinary. One thing has not, and that’s the quality of the debate about America’s economic future. Beyond the vibes — both the angry ones and the joyful ones — there’s been little to help Americans decide who better can steward the $29 trillion economy.

News Title: The Army of Election Officials Ready to Reject the Vote
News Abstract: A movement driven by disinformation about Trump’s 2020 defeat has taken over many of the boards that certify elections. It could cause chaos in the weeks ahead.
News Content: When Clara Andriola took her seat at the Washoe County, Nev., commission meeting room on July 9, she looked out at a sea of angry faces. The commission is Washoe’s main legislative body, and Andriola, a longtime local business executive, was appointed to fill a vacancy on the five-person board last year. She had just won a Republican primary that would almost certainly allow her to keep that seat in the November general election. The commission was required by law to certify elections at every level, from local primary to presidential election. What came next should have been a simple administrative procedure.

News Title: Three Mile Island, Notorious in Nuclear Power’s Past, May Herald Its Future
News Abstract: The Pennsylvania plant, site of the worst U.S. nuclear energy accident, is at the forefront of efforts to expand nuclear capacity to meet rising electricity demand.
News Content: The concrete cooling towers that rise from a sliver of land south of Pennsylvania’s capital became symbols nearly a half-century ago of the risks of nuclear energy.
